com.ucsf.core.services

Class Services.Provider

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ucsf.core.services.Services.Provider
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BackgroundService.Provider, RecurringService.Provider, ServerListenerService.Provider
    Enclosing class:
    Services

    public abstract static class Services.Provider
extends java.lang.Object
    Service provider interface. A service provider is responsible of managing the life cycle of an event, i.e. starting and stoping it. It also provides the services parameters.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Services.Provider.PersistentParameter<T extends java.io.Serializable>
      Wrapper around a PersistentParameter to not have to pass the context all the time.

    • Method Detail

      • startService

        protected abstract void startService(ResponseListener listener)
        Starts the service managed by this service. This method doesn't check if the service is already running or if it can run at all, therefore don't call this method directly, use start(ResponseListener listener) instead.

      • stopService

        protected abstract void stopService()
        Stops the service managed by this service. This method doesn't check if the service is running, therefore don't call this method directly, use stop() instead.

      • isServiceRunning

        public abstract boolean isServiceRunning()
        Indicates if the service is currently running.

      • addParameter

        protected <T extends java.io.Serializable> ServiceParameter<T> addParameter(java.lang.String tag,
                                                                            int descriptionId,
                                                                            T value)
        Add a new service parameter to the service.

      • addParameter

        protected <T extends java.io.Serializable> ServiceParameter<T> addParameter(java.lang.String tag,
                                                                            java.lang.String description,
                                                                            T value)
        Add a new service parameter to the service.

      • addParameter

        protected <T extends java.io.Serializable> ServiceParameter<T> addParameter(ServiceParameter<T> parameter)
        Add a new service parameter to the service which is a copy of the given one.

      • addCallback

        protected ServiceCallback addCallback(java.lang.String tag,
                                      int description,
                                      java.lang.String annotation)
        Add a new service callback to the service.

      • setParameterDefaultValue

        protected <T extends java.io.Serializable> void setParameterDefaultValue(java.lang.String tag,
                                                                         T value)
        Modify the default value of a service parameter (to call in the constructor of a daughter class).

      • getProperties

        public java.util.List<ServiceProperty> getProperties()
        Returns the registered service properties. Properties are registered when they are instantiated through call of addParameter() or addCallback().

      • getProperty

        public ServiceProperty getProperty(java.lang.String tag)
        Returns the registered service property with the given tag. Properties are registered when they are instantiated through call of addParameter() or addCallback().

      • getParameter

        public <T extends java.io.Serializable> ServiceParameter<T> getParameter(java.lang.String tag)
        Returns the registered service parameter with the given tag. Parameters are registered when they are instantiated through call of addParameter().

      • getCallback

        public ServiceCallback getCallback(java.lang.String tag)
        Returns the registered service callback with the given tag. Callbacks are registered when they are instantiated through call of addCallback(String, int, String) addCallback()}.

      • getServiceName

        public java.lang.String getServiceName()
        Returns the service name.

      • getServiceDescription

        public java.lang.String getServiceDescription()
        Returns the service description.

      • isServiceEnabled

        public boolean isServiceEnabled()
        Indicates if the service is currently enabled.

      • start

        public final void start(ResponseListener listener)
        Starts the service managed by this provider. The service will not be started if it is already running, not enabled or if services are not enabled. Calls startService(ResponseListener).

      • start

        public final void start()
        Starts the service managed by this provider. The service will not be started if it is already running, not enabled or if services are not enabled. Calls startService(ResponseListener).

      • stop

        public final void stop()
        Stops the service managed by this provider. Do nothing if the service is not running. Calls stopService().
